message.content:
<<<api>>>: HttpServletRequest.getParameterNames
<<<code>>>: try {
    FileWriter writer = new FileWriter("OrderFormData.csv");
    writer.append("FieldName");
    writer.append(',');
    writer.append("Value");
    writer.append('\n');
    Enumeration<String> paramNames = request.getParameterNames();
    while (paramNames.hasMoreElements()) {
        String paramName = paramNames.nextElement();
        writer.append(paramName);
        writer.append(',');
        String[] paramValues = request.getParameterValues(paramName);
        if (paramValues.length == 1) {
            String paramValue = paramValues[0];
            if (paramValue.length() == 0) {
                writer.append("No Value");
                writer.append('\n');
            } else {
                writer.append(paramValue);
                writer.append('\n');
            }
        } else {
            for (int i = 0; i < paramValues.length; i++) {
                writer.append(paramValues[i]);
                writer.append(',');
            }
            writer.append('\n');
        }
    }
    writer.flush();
    writer.close();
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue you are facing is that the HttpServletRequest.getParameterNames() method only returns the names of the checkboxes that are checked. To get all the checkboxes, whether checked or unchecked, you can use the HttpServletRequest.getParameterMap() method instead. This method returns a Map of parameter names to their corresponding values. You can iterate over this map to get all the checkboxes and their values.
